Class Do

java.lang.Object
com.github.cl_journeyor.pfunp.Do
public final class Do extends Object
Utility functions for functional programming.

Passing null to a functional interface argument from any method of this class will throw a NullPointerException, unless noted otherwise.

Since:
1.0-SNAPSHOT

    Method
    Description

    repeat(T item)

    static <T> T
    scope(Supplier<T> supplier)
    Defines a new local scope on which statements may be written in order to return a new value.
    static <T, X extends Throwable>
    T
    scopeX(SupplierX<T,X> supplier)
    Defines a nested scope on which statements may be written in order to return a value, with the chance to propagate checked exceptions to the enclosing scope.

    Takes a mutable object, mutates it with the provided mutator function and returns the mutated object, with the chance to propagate checked exceptions to the caller.
    static <T> T
    until(T seed, Predicate<T> condition, UnaryOperator<T> accumulator)
    Accumulates the provided seed on loop and returns it when the condition is true.

  • Method Details

    • repeat

      public static <T> Stream<T> repeat(T item)
      Returns an infinite stream by repeating the provided value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the repeated value
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be repeated in the stream
      Returns:
      the infinite stream

    • scope

      public static <T> T scope(Supplier<T> supplier)
      Defines a new local scope on which statements may be written in order to return a new value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value this local scope returns
      Parameters:
      supplier - a parameterless function that allows writting statements within an expression
      Returns:
      what the supplier returns

    • scopeX

      public static <T, X extends Throwable> T scopeX(SupplierX<T,X> supplier) throws X
      Defines a nested scope on which statements may be written in order to return a value, with the chance to propagate checked exceptions to the enclosing scope.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value this scope returns
      X - the type of the exception the scope may throw
      Parameters:
      supplier - a parameterless function that allows writting statements within an expression
      Returns:
      what the supplier returns
      Throws:
      X - if the supplier fails to return

    • to

      public static <T> T to(T mutable, Consumer<T> mutator)
      Takes a mutable object, mutates it with the provided mutator function and returns the mutated object.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the mutable object
      Parameters:
      mutable - an object
      mutator - a procedure that takes the mutable object
      Returns:
      the mutated object

    • toX

      public static <T, X extends Throwable> T toX(T mutable, ConsumerX<T,X> mutator) throws X
      Takes a mutable object, mutates it with the provided mutator function and returns the mutated object, with the chance to propagate checked exceptions to the caller.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the mutable object
      X - the type of the exception the mutator may throw
      Parameters:
      mutable - an object
      mutator - a procedure that takes the mutable object
      Returns:
      the mutated object
      Throws:
      X - if the mutator fails to complete

    • until

      public static <T> T until(T seed, Predicate<T> condition, UnaryOperator<T> accumulator)
      Accumulates the provided seed on loop and returns it when the condition is true.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the initial value (seed)
      Parameters:
      seed - the value to be tested and accumulated
      condition - the condition that controls the loop
      accumulator - a function to be applied to the seed
      Returns:
      the result of accumulating the seed once the condition is true
